tweets.text: Weather looking a bit better in Yorkshire & North East today. Two flood warnings issued early this morning for Bishop Monkton and Roecliffe. Masham still in force (#Boroughbridge #Ripon #NorthYorks), plus flood alert at River Wansbeck, Morpeth. See more at https://t.co/xADRoYQTUa https://t.co/x4D4gDoA9k

Time for a night shift as @EnvAgencyNW duty manager. Thankfully much better picture than last night. Not currently expecting further #flood warnings / alerts. Worst of the üåß gone in the next couple of hrs. Info at https://t.co/vKsRlvVySm #floodaware https://t.co/1UlcPY4qUT

tweets.text: Incredibly excited about launching the @NORA_Europe and @NativeOysterNet joint publication on #oyster restoration #biosecurity at #NORA3 tomorrow! Such a fantastic and knowledgeable authorship team. Thanks to all and to the workshop sponsors @EnvAgency @LIFEprogramme  @EllermanUK https://t.co/93W23EAozD
@AquaUoS @RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro If only I knew what 'avulsion' and 'anastomosing' meant

A happy announcement - Revitalising Redesdale reached its halfway milestone earlier this year! üëè 

We're really proud of our achievements so far. Thank you to all who have helped along the way!

Read on for the full report... 

https://t.co/rq1wwM1hw3 https://t.co/0Ra8jzUcME

tweets.text: News from upstream . #ripon BoroBridge Rd on the outskirts of the city closed as Ure floods. always a sign of a lot of water heading to #york. @EnvAgencyYNE have flood alert in force here atm.  Take care if travelling across #NorthYorkshire @theyorkmix news - R Skell earlier https://t.co/8GGWkel8nN

Our fisheries enforcement officers have joined forces with @DurhamPolice in a rural crime crackdown in the North East. 

It follows reports of illegal fishing and anti-social behaviour in areas of Weardale. 

#illegal 
#crime 
#fishing 

Read more: https://t.co/FOYluBoUEi https://t.co/XeVBjBHCCH

They are building the elevated walkway again #skeldergate #york #floods Obviously this is not unusual when the ouse over tops the bank. @CityofYork @EnvAgencyYNE @theyorkmix #yorknews https://t.co/dNjkN77Sqe

People think they‚Äôve paid to have their rubbish taken away legally‚Ä¶

WATCH senior crime officer Nigel Oliver on #BBC1‚Äôs #DefendersUK, talk about pursuing #Hampshire waste criminals to court: https://t.co/hLyQUnyI87 https://t.co/6IyOzUk9Mx

tweets.text:
Day 83

2020 has more to give.

The public finding out about toxic #PFOS and #PFAS chemicals in UK waters. 

 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News @jonsnowC4 @EnvAgencyYNE @WCL_News @annalom87 @GeorgeGreenwood https://t.co/kTMLWKKZPP

Enhancement of the sediment build up at a frequent breach point on the beck has taken a few floods to instigate channel switching but this process is now well and truly underway with permanent flow over the floodplain 
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/qCSePtR8wg

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service ‚Äì your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

tweets.text:
If you're having a clear-out and need someone to get rid of your rubbish - check they are a registered waste carrier first. 

Responsible waste carriers are registered with us: https://t.co/Z9loMhOWRa

Help avoid #flytipping and #wastecrime.

tweets.text:
Due to the #Coronavirus Pandemic, this Bonfire Night will be a little different. 

We‚Äôre asking people to think twice about having a bonfire. Protect your loved ones, the environment and our emergency services. 

#BonfireNight https://t.co/TLHpbydzKb

Bit by bit we‚Äôre opening our rivers back up for fish! 

Last week, @GroundworkGM @greatermcr  @natural_course and #TeamEA removed this disused failing weir on the River Tonge as part of a partnership project to help üêü swim freely and reach their natural spawning grounds https://t.co/cwHYCcEW6X

tweets.text: A nicely captured (zoom!) Boeing 727 of the Oil Spill Response Limited @oilspillexperts. They operate a first-of-a-kind capability for the oil and gas industry deploying dispersants which break down oil slicks into smaller droplets so that they can be more easily biodegraded. ^KF https://t.co/ALEyqMN9Mj

A short film made with some very passionate folk in this video explaining just a little bit about what we have been doing in our little corner of the world. 
I hope you like it and it gives a little hope in troubled times
https://t.co/WSMCBBdd0y

Went for a walk along my local river yesterday and found nothing but raw sewage pollution, EVERYWHERE.üò∑üí©

This isn't good enough @wessexwater @EnvAgencySW üò§

Plz email your MP to ask them to support the Inland Waters Bill - link in bio üôåüèª

@sascampaigns https://t.co/ZRituiFWrc

08:50 02/11/20 There are multiple flood alerts and warnings issued by the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE covering the River Ouse catchment areas but nothing for the actual Upper River Ouse at the moment. Stay out of flood water and find an alternative route. https://t.co/dsxTEgbih4

Work to encourage channel avulsion on Swindale beck finally crosses tipping point. Recent floods have started an avulsion creating 5 hectares of anastomosing wetland. Minor intervention and patience have eventually paid off!
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/biaKE3rFDA

Don't underestimate the size of the European waste mafia which ships waste all over the üåé even in lockdown. Nowadays it's trucked out of UK to end up who knows where. 

In 2018/19 @EnvAgency¬†prevented 13,000 tonnes of waste destined for illegal export.

https://t.co/wsChuIjDzP

tweets.text: The weather forecast is drier for the coming days, however we still have Flood Warnings in place in Yorkshire. Stay vigilant, don't walk or drive through any flood water, and keep up-to-date with your local flood risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #PrepareActSurvive #floodaware

New data explorer tool available integrating @EnvAgency  and @Earthwatch_Eur volunteer-collected water quality data with @Riverflies data for the Thames.

Thames WaterBlitz overview: https://t.co/VFTIrDK8Jg
Data explorer: https://t.co/HhD2aXFu2i https://t.co/jTvwxRNvkd

Based in Collingham, Wetherby, Thorpe Arch, Boston Spa or Linton? We‚Äôre investigating flood risk in the Wharfedale area and want to hear from you. Visit https://t.co/2tmx58rqMX #Leeds #RiverWharfe #flooding @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/4WcQXC4Dsn

Armenian Environmental Groups Raise "Ecocide" Alert in Artsakh
https://t.co/5sHDqCIF0k https://t.co/CvpLf1cqAx

Thurs. 19 November! @Recoup_UK #Plastics #Resources & #Recycling: Farming and Opportunities and Challenges to Reduce Plastic Use chaired by Mike Baxter @BerryGlobalInc  joined by speakers from @EnvAgency, @NFUtweets, @Cleanfarms & @TIPACorp! 
 
Book now: https://t.co/srgH6bakC3 https://t.co/eo1ifoIBxM

Volunteers helping remove a fence at Flimby - first step towards restoring a kested hedgerow. Part of our natural flood management project in the area to #slowtheflow. In partnership with @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/P1xvb5UFBR

tweets.text: Made some time this lunchtime to join an @EnvAgencyNW staff session on #ClimateChange a timely reminder of the big challenge we face https://t.co/6P9N0ap47u

It's day 2 of conference!

Our first panel:

'The state of English and Welsh rivers'

Chair: @SteveOrmerod, Cardiff Uni
Panellists: Arlin Rickard of @theriverstrust; @acrharrington of @DwrCymru; @alicertchie of @CLAtweets; Helen Wakeham of @EnvAgency; Mark Squire of @NatResWales

We are continuing to work around the clock to monitor flood risk and warn communities, following heavy rainfall at the weekend. There are 21 Flood Warnings in force in Yorkshire - please check your local flood risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

Fantastic Panel Discussion The State of English #Rivers @Gw4Water Conference this morning. Thank you to our Panel: Arlin Rickard @theriverstrust @acrharrington of @DwrCymru @alicertchie @CLAtweets Helen Wakeham @EnvAgency Mark Squire @NatResWales and Chair @SteveOrmerod https://t.co/xTcDSvuu1d

@WandleForum @Wandle_Trust @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Please keep reporting this (0800 80 70 60) as soon as you see it. This will give them the best chance of getting to site during the incident and being able to trace it within the large surface water catchment before the source disappears.

@WandleForum @Wandle_Trust @EnvAgencySE @thameswater The main problem the @EnvAgencySE and @thameswater seem to be having is that they are are struggling to trace the precise source as it stops before they arrive on site.
We're looking into what we can do to help, including the possibility of taking samples.

There are still flood warnings and alerts out in North Yorks, inc. on River Ure, Swale, Nidd and Ouse following heavy rain. Levels are expected to rise in York over the next 36 hours. The Foss Barrier has been lowered to reduce flood risk to homes. https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/uqdzkdU8br

Although times may be difficult for many businesses at the moment, it is important to bear in mind your #floodrisk and take even simple actions to make yourself more flood resilient, such as by signing up to @EnvAgencyNW free flood alerts and warnings! ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/e13FGpysOu https://t.co/V62iESwdln

We're really excited to be able to bring you this news!
A great example of partnership working between @EnvAgencyNW @GroundworkGM and @GMGreenCity 

For more info about the project, check out...
https://t.co/QNaM3nmGCU https://t.co/5pOG2ER4zZ

Do join us for our virtual public meeting on Wednesday to discuss our plans for new Bishopthorpe flood defences in York, 6.30pm.

It will be held via  zoom  
ID: 812 6062 9756
Password: YorkC1

Ask any questions with Slido (code #YorkC1) before or during the event
#Flood #YorkFAS https://t.co/RiJwKpIACw

@richard_ebbs @AquaUoS @RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience Hi @richard_ebbs. Left is looking downstream from the splay. the right upstream. Below are the same pictures but with (very poor) river flow arrows on them :-)  The right picture shows an 'A' where the first drone picture is taken. Hope this helps. https://t.co/ovH5PD4yAk
